commits.message: Correctly disallow hyphens in modifier names

issue.title: Issue with `*-comma-after-newline` rules
issue.body:
```css
transition:
  background-color 0.3s ease,
  backdrop-filter 0.3s ease,
  color 0.3s ease;
```

The above works fine locally, but upon saving the pre-commit hook updates the rule to be single line and I get errors about the following rules: `declaration-colon-newline-after` and `value-list-comma-newline-after`.

I'm unsure if this is a Prettier vs Stylelint conflict, an issue in Stylelint itself or something else but figured it was best I share here

comment.body: What you have there is my preferred way of it working. Do you know which one of the rules it's crying about?

issue.title: [Feature]: The ability to provide custom templates
issue.body:
### What area(s) will this request affect?

App

### What type of change do you want to see?

Substantial change to existing feature

### Overview

Currently, the `shopify app create` command is limited to 3 templates defined [here](https://github.com/Shopify/cli/blob/main/packages/create-app/src/prompts/init.ts#L16). All of these provide excellent starting points but can leave a decent bit of room for feature evolution.

Taking the Node repo as an example. Converting it to Typescript, adding a job queue to handle webhooks, adding a more production-ready relational database, etc. could add a good few initial days to any app build.

The ability to provide a custom template (assuming it's 3.0 compatible) would mean the community can evolve and curate the existing templates to try and fill common gaps that are intentionally left by making the Shopify ones unopinionated.

### Motivation

We're an agency that creates many custom apps so quite often start and then need to patch on our typical "stack" which can be tedious unless automated.
